content: when the foot of your sock reaches this measurement measured from the toe alternatively just try the sock on and start the heel turn when it is level with your ankle bone how many markers each side of the heel turn when you turn the heel you are only working on half of the total number of stitches you need to divide that half into as close as possible to thirds one third will be the centre stitches the other two thirds will be the short row that shape the heel so for example if you are knitting a 60 stitch sock - your heel will be worked over a total of 30 stitches divide that by 3 and you will have 10 centre stitches and 10 markers on each side theperfectsockbyjotorr 4of5 wwwj otorr co uk copyright2016 photo tutorial for increases all the markers have been placed during the decreases now ready to start increases knit side purl side knit to one stitch before marker purl to one stitch before marker slip next stitch slip next stitch lift bar between stitches and put onto lift bar between stitches and put onto right hand needle right hand needle knit bar together with previously purl bar together with previously slipped stitch through back of slipped stitch stitches theperfectsockbyjotorr 5of5 wwwj otorr co uk copyright2016
